sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

sentences.english: Teaching young children is a challenging and rewarding job.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿教育是一项具有挑战性和有意义的工作。

sentences.english: a challenging problem
sentences.chinese: 具有挑战性的难题

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战的；引起挑战性兴趣的
detailed_translations.english: difficult in an interesting or enjoyable way

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求；质疑；反对；向…挑战；盘问（challenge的ing形式）

name: rewarding
trans: 有益的, 有报酬的, 有所得的

sentences.english: Teaching can be a very rewarding career.
sentences.chinese: 教书可以是一种很有意义的职业。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel happy and satisfied because you feel you are doing something useful or important, even if you do not earn much money

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

sentences.english: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

sentences.english: We strongly support the peace process.
sentences.chinese: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持， 支撑物， 支持者
detailed_translations.english: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

sentences.english: He earns nearly £20,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 他每年挣近20,000英镑。

sentences.english: You don’t earn much money being a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 当护士挣钱并不多。

sentences.english: He did all sorts of jobs to earn a living.
sentences.chinese: 他为谋生什么活都干。

sentences.english: I was the only person in the house who was earning.
sentences.chinese: 我是家里唯一上班挣钱的人。

sentences.english: She was earning good money at the bank.
sentences.chinese: 她在银行工作，收入不错。

sentences.english: You could earn a higher rate of interest elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 你在别处可以获得更高的利率。

detailed_translations.english: to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do

sentences.english: Completing the race is not just a simple matter of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑完比赛不仅仅是纯粹的体力问题。

sentences.english: I’m afraid Luke’s a bit simple.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得卢克有点笨。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that only one thing is involved

sentences.english: a complicated pattern
sentences.chinese: 复杂的图案

sentences.english: The human brain is an incredibly complicated organ.
sentences.chinese: 人脑是一个结构极其复杂的器官。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of many closely connected parts

sentences.english: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
sentences.chinese: 海底发现有丰富的矿床。

sentences.english: Red meat is a rich source of iron.
sentences.chinese: 红肉含有大量铁质。

sentences.english: This is a system in which the rich are taken care of and the poor are left to suffer.
sentences.chinese: 这是个富人受关照，而穷人遭罪的制度。

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of something

detailed_translations.chinese: (Rich)人名；(丹)里克；(捷)里赫；(英、西)里奇；(葡、法)里什
detailed_translations.english: The rich are rich people

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

sentences.english: the long-term future of the fishing industry
sentences.chinese: 渔业的长远未来

sentences.english: the long-term interests of the company
sentences.chinese: 公司的长远利益

sentences.english: the long-term effects of alcohol on the body
sentences.chinese: 酒精对人体的长期影响

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a long period of time, or relating to what will happen in the distant future

name: normal
trans: 正常的, 正规的, 标准的

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

sentences.english: She has just landed the lead role in their latest production.
sentences.chinese: 她刚在他们最新的作品中取得了主角。

detailed_translations.english: the character played by an actor in a play or film

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

sentences.english: Lie in a comfortable position .
sentences.chinese: 以一个舒服的姿势躺下。

sentences.english: Our hotel was in a superb central position near St Mark’s Square.
sentences.chinese: 我们的酒店处于极佳的中心位置，在圣马克广场附近。

sentences.english: Bruce is thinking of applying for the position.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯正在考虑申请那个职位。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone is standing, sitting, or lying

sentences.english: I work in the oil industry.
sentences.chinese: 我在石油行业工作。

sentences.english: Italy’s thriving tourist industry
sentences.chinese: 意大利蓬勃发展的旅游业

sentences.english: Gould is a man of great industry.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德是一个很勤劳的人。

detailed_translations.english: businesses that produce a particular type of thing or provide a particular service

name: sector
trans: 部门, 行业, 机构

sentences.english: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.
sentences.chinese: …该国的制造部门。

detailed_translations.english: a part of an area of activity, especially of business, trade etc

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

sentences.english: I’ve never heard anything so foolish in all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我这辈子从没听到过这么愚蠢的话。

sentences.english: It would be foolish to ignore his advice.
sentences.chinese: 不听他的劝告才傻呢。

detailed_translations.english: a foolish action, remark etc is stupid and shows that someone is not thinking sensibly

name: odd
trans: 奇怪的, 古怪的, 奇特的, 异常的

sentences.english: It was an odd thing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这话说得很奇怪。

sentences.english: an odd way to behave
sentences.chinese: 古怪的行为

sentences.english: They’re an odd couple.
sentences.chinese: 他们是古怪的一对。

sentences.english: There was something odd about him.
sentences.chinese: 他这人有些奇怪。

sentences.english: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
sentences.chinese: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的，但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。

sentences.english: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
sentences.chinese: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

detailed_translations.english: different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand

sentences.english: Her family were so poor they couldn’t afford to buy her new clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她家穷得甚至买不起新衣服给她。

sentences.english: an area where poor people lived
sentences.chinese: 穷人居住区

sentences.english: one of the poorest countries in the world
sentences.chinese: 世界上最贫穷的国家之一

sentences.english: a poor part of Chicago (= where a lot of poor people live )
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥的一个贫民区

sentences.english: My grandparents grew up dirt poor (= very poor ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母在赤贫的环境里长大。

sentences.english: The country is poor in natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 该国自然资源匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: having very little money and not many possessions

name: talented
trans: 有天才的, 有才干的

sentences.english: a talented actor
sentences.chinese: 一名很有天赋的演员

detailed_translations.english: having a natural ability to do something well

name: wise
trans: 英明的, 慎虑的, 明智的

sentences.english: a wise precaution
sentences.chinese: 明智的预防措施

sentences.english: I don’t think that would be a very wise move (= not be a sensible thing to do ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为那样做不是很明智。

detailed_translations.english: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

sentences.english: The information you gave us was incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 你给我们的信息不准确。

detailed_translations.english: not correct or true

sentences.english: It’s exactly half past five.
sentences.chinese: 一分不差，正好5点半。

sentences.english: The figures may not be exactly right, but they’re close enough.
sentences.chinese: 那些数字可能不是非常精确，但也相当接近。

sentences.english: That’s exactly what we’ve been trying to tell you.
sentences.chinese: 那正是我们一直想告诉你的。

detailed_translations.english: used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail

name: sure
trans: 确信的, 有把握的, 确实的, 一定的, 必定的, 可靠的

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

name: worry
trans: 担忧, 担心, 发愁

sentences.english: He’s been a constant source of worry .
sentences.chinese: 他总是让人担心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being anxious about something
to be anxious or unhappy about someone or something, so that you think about them a lot

sentences.english: There must have been some misunderstanding. I didn’t order all these books.
sentences.chinese: 一定是弄错了，这些书不全是我订的。

detailed_translations.english: a problem caused by someone not understanding a question, situation, or instruction correctly

sentences.english: a historic spa town
sentences.chinese: 一座历史上有名的矿泉城镇

detailed_translations.chinese: 矿泉；温泉浴场；矿泉治疗地
detailed_translations.english: a place where the water has special minerals in it, and where people go to improve their health by drinking the water or swimming in it

sentences.english: Representatives from over 100 countries attended the International Peace Conference in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 来自一百多个国家的代表出席了在日内瓦举行的国际和平大会。

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

sentences.english: I go to the gym as often as I can.
sentences.chinese: 我一有空就去健身房健身。

detailed_translations.english: a special building or room that has equipment for doing physical exercise

sentences.english: He plays golf on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 他星期天都去打高尔夫球。

sentences.english: a round of golf
sentences.chinese: 一场高尔夫球赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尔夫球；高尔夫球运动
detailed_translations.english: a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

sentences.english: The plane landed at Heathrow Airport.
sentences.chinese: 飞机降落在希思罗机场。

sentences.english: Her family went to see her off at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人去机场送她。

detailed_translations.english: a place where planes take off and land, with buildings for passengers to wait in

sentences.english: He made some highly critical remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他发表了一些严厉的批判性言论。

detailed_translations.english: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

sentences.english: ‘Do you let your kids travel alone at night?’ ‘Absolutely not!’
sentences.chinese: “你会让孩子们晚上单独外出吗？”“当然不行！”

detailed_translations.english: used when you strongly disagree with someone or when you do not want someone to do something

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

detailed_translations.english: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

name: informed
trans: 见多识广的, 消息灵通的, 有学问的

sentences.english: Informed sources said it was likely that the president would make a televised statement.
sentences.chinese: 据消息灵通人士说，总统可能会发表电视声明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 消息灵通的；见多识广的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 通知；使了解；提供资料（inform的过去分词）

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

name: suit
trans: 使合适, 使适应, 相称

sentences.english: Johnson has filed suit against her.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。

sentences.english: a civil suit
sentences.chinese: 民事诉讼

sentences.english: There are countryside walks to suit everyone.
sentences.chinese: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
to be acceptable, suitable, or  convenient  for a particular person or in a particular situation

sentences.english: I’ve just started reading a book by Graham Greene.
sentences.chinese: 我刚开始看格雷厄姆·格林写的一本书。

sentences.english: a cookery book
sentences.chinese: 烹饪书

sentences.english: Have you booked a holiday this year?
sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？

detailed_translations.english: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover so that you can read them
to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

sentences.english: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
sentences.chinese: 窗锁相当便宜，绝对有必要安装。

sentences.english: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
sentences.chinese: 即使在小公司里，计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary
something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation

name: imperative
trans: 紧急; 重要; 需要立即处理

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

sentences.english: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 他急需治疗。

sentences.english: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
sentences.chinese: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动，减少汽油中的铅含量。

sentences.english: an urgent message
sentences.chinese: 一封急报

detailed_translations.english: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately

name: vital
trans: 至关重要的, 生死攸关的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: until
trans: 迄......之时, 在......以前, 到 为止, 直到......才, 在 以前

sentences.english: The ticket is valid until March.
sentences.chinese: 这张票的有效期一直到 3 月份。

sentences.english: He waited until she had finished speaking.
sentences.chinese: 他一直等到她讲完。

sentences.english: Until recently, Anna worked as a teacher in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近，安娜一直在日本当老师。

sentences.english: Up until last year, they didn’t even own a car.
sentences.chinese: 一直到去年，他们连汽车也没有。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time
if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: option
trans: 选择, 选择权, 选择自由

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

sentences.english: an accessory to murder
sentences.chinese: 谋杀案的帮凶

sentences.english: the accessory muscles of respiration
sentences.chinese: 副呼吸肌

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
not the most important when compared to others

sentences.english: The strap of my bag is broken.
sentences.chinese: 我包上的带子断了。

sentences.english: soldiers with grenades strapped to their belts
sentences.chinese: 腰带上绑着手榴弹的士兵

detailed_translations.english: a narrow band of strong material that is used to fasten, hang, or hold onto something
to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

name: cable
trans: (系船用的)缆绳, (船只, 桥梁等上的)巨缆

sentences.english: The miners rode a conveyance attached to a cable made of braided steel wire.
sentences.chinese: 矿工们乘坐连着钢索的缆车。

sentences.english: cables and switches for computers
sentences.chinese: 电脑的缆线和开关

sentences.english: She sent a cable to her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她给母亲发了封电报。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong metal rope used on ships, to support bridges etc

sentences.english: (= I have been told ) to give the package to him personally.
sentences.chinese: 我接到的指示是亲手把包裹交给他。

sentences.english: Make sure you carry out the doctor’s instructions.
sentences.chinese: 你一定要遵照医生的嘱咐。

sentences.english: The school gives instruction in first aid.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校教授急救课

detailed_translations.english: a statement telling someone what they must do

sentences.english: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.english: a severe case of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒重病例

sentences.english: It is simply not the case that prison conditions are improving.
sentences.chinese: 监狱条件得到改善的情况绝非事实。

detailed_translations.english: a particular situation or a situation of a particular type

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

sentences.english: Keep your receipt in case you want to bring it back.
sentences.chinese: 保留收据以备退货之需。

sentences.english: Can you give me a receipt?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我一个收条吗？

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

sentences.english: Employees must show their identity cards at the gate.
sentences.chinese: 雇员在大门口必须出示自己的身份卡。

sentences.english: I haven’t got my membership card yet.
sentences.chinese: 我还没拿到会员卡。

sentences.english: a piece of card
sentences.chinese: 一张卡片纸

sentences.english: My name’s Adam Carver. Here’s my card.
sentences.chinese: 我叫亚当•卡弗，这是我的名片。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of plastic or paper containing information about a person or showing, for example, that they belong to a particular organization, club etc

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

sentences.english: No-one enjoys paying tax.
sentences.chinese: 没人喜欢缴税。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you must pay to the government according to your income, property, goods etc and that is used to pay for public services

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…征税； 使负担重， 使费尽力气
detailed_translations.english: to charge a tax on something

sentences.english: They refused to give me a refund .
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

name: return
trans: 退还, 返还, 归还

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

name: policy
trans: 政策, 方针, 策略

sentences.english: US policy towards China
sentences.chinese: 美国的对华政策

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

sentences.english: New technology is going to revolutionize everything we do.
sentences.chinese: 新科技将彻底改变我们做的每一件事。

sentences.english: His work revolutionized the treatment of this disease.
sentences.chinese: 他的研究成果给这种疾病的治疗带来了革命。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the way people do something or think about something

name: cause
trans: 引起, 导致, 造成

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

sentences.english: the long-term effects of the drug
sentences.chinese: 这种毒品的长期影响

sentences.english: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
sentences.chinese: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。

sentences.english: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
sentences.chinese: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。

sentences.english: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
sentences.chinese: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。

sentences.english: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
sentences.chinese: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响

sentences.english: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
sentences.chinese: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。

detailed_translations.english: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

sentences.english: The cashier absconded with the money.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员携款潜逃。

sentences.english: The cashier had run out with eighty thousand pounds in cash.
sentences.chinese: 这个出纳员带着八万镑现钞消失得无影无踪。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to receive or pay out money in a shop

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

sentences.english: New drugs are producing remarkable results.
sentences.chinese: 新药正在产生显著的效果。

sentences.english: a rise in sea level produced by climatic change
sentences.chinese: 由气候变化引起的海平面升高

sentences.english: As a policy, it did not produce the desired effect.
sentences.chinese: 作为一项政策，它并未产生预期的效果。

sentences.english: a factory that produces microchips
sentences.chinese: 微芯片制造厂

sentences.english: He produced a letter from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋里掏出一封信来。

detailed_translations.english: to cause a particular result or effect

sentences.english: ...one of the country's biggest food suppliers.
sentences.chinese: …该国最大的食品供应商之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 供应厂商，供应国；供应者
detailed_translations.english: a company or person that provides a particular product

name: seem
trans: 看上去, 像是, 似乎

sentences.english: Ann didn’t seem very sure.
sentences.chinese: 安看来并不十分肯定。

sentences.english: It seems a foolish decision now.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来这是一个愚蠢的决定。

sentences.english: It seems like you’re catching a cold, Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 你好像感冒了，泰勒。

sentences.english: ‘So Bill’s leaving her?’ ‘ So it seems (= that seems to be true ) .’
sentences.chinese: “这么说来，比尔要离开她？”“好像是这样。”

detailed_translations.english: if something seems to be true, there are qualities or facts that make people think it is true

sentences.english: the funniest man in Britain
sentences.chinese: 英国最滑稽的男人

sentences.english: If this is your idea of a joke, I don’t find it at all funny .
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得这是个玩笑，那我认为它一点也不好笑。

sentences.english: Luckily, when I explained the situation, he saw the funny side (= recognized that it was partly funny ) .
sentences.chinese: 好在我把情况解释了以后，他看到了好笑的一面。

sentences.english: His laughter stopped her mid-sentence. ‘ What’s so funny? ’ she demanded.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑声打断了她的话。“有什么好笑的？”她厉声问道。

sentences.english: What’s that funny smell?
sentences.chinese: 那是什么怪味？

detailed_translations.english: making you laugh

sentences.english: The test was easy.
sentences.chinese: 考试很容易。

sentences.english: Finishing the task will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 完成这项任务并不容易。

sentences.english: There must be an easier way to do that.
sentences.chinese: 一定有更容易的方法去做那件事。

sentences.english: instructions that are easy to follow
sentences.chinese: 易于掌握的使用说明

sentences.english: It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 球队本来是很容易会输掉这场比赛的。

sentences.english: Having you here does make things a lot easier for me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，有你在这里事情的确好办多了。

sentences.english: On the whole, Dad has had an easy life.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，爸爸过着安逸舒适的生活。

sentences.english: You can have an easy time of it now that the kids have all left home.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们都离开了家，你日子可以过得轻松了。

detailed_translations.english: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort

sentences.english: She splashed her face with cold water.
sentences.chinese: 她往脸上泼冷水。

sentences.english: a blast of cold air
sentences.chinese: 一股冷空气

sentences.english: We slept on the cold ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们睡在冰冷的地上。

sentences.english: The house felt cold and empty.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里感觉很冷，空荡荡的。

sentences.english: Martin was really cold towards me at the party.
sentences.chinese: 马丁在聚会上对我非常冷淡。

sentences.english: I was shivering with cold.
sentences.chinese: 我冷得发抖。

detailed_translations.english: something that is cold has a low temperature
a low temperature or cold weather

sentences.english: a hard wooden chair
sentences.chinese: 一把硬木椅

sentences.english: the hardest substance known to man
sentences.chinese: 已知的最硬物质

sentences.english: After months without rain, the ground was too hard to plough.
sentences.chinese: 数月无雨，土地坚硬难犁。

sentences.english: This year’s exam was much harder than last year’s.
sentences.chinese: 今年的考试比去年的难得多。

detailed_translations.english: firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut

name: read
trans: 推断出，读懂，看透（想法或心思）

sentences.english: I can’t read your writing.
sentences.chinese: 我看不懂你写的东西。

sentences.english: She picked up the letter and read it.
sentences.chinese: 她拿起信读了起来。

sentences.english: Read the instructions carefully before you start.
sentences.chinese: 开始前要仔细阅读说明。

sentences.english: children who are just learning to read and write
sentences.chinese: 刚刚开始学习读和写的儿童

sentences.english: Her books are quite widely read (= read by a lot of people ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的书读者很多。

sentences.english: When I was young, I read every one of his books from cover to cover (= read all of something because you are very interested ) .
sentences.chinese: 我小时候，他的每一本书我都从头到尾一页不落地看过。

detailed_translations.english: to look at written words and understand what they mean
to look at written words and understand what they mean

name: aggressive
trans: 挑衅的, 有侵略性的, 好斗的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: Women usually live longer than men.
sentences.chinese: 女人通常比男人长寿。

sentences.english: Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.
sentences.chinese: 通常我都穿黑色、灰色或者棕色的衣服。

sentences.english: The drive usually takes 15 or 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 这段车程通常需要 15 或 20 分钟。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about what happens on most occasions or in most situations

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the more expensive the stereo, the better it is.
sentences.chinese: 一般说来，立体声音响越贵的越好。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that is true in most cases but not always

sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: investigate
trans: 调查, 审查, 研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

sentences.english: I’ve known Barbara for years. Since we were babies, actually.
sentences.chinese: 我认识芭芭拉很多年了，实际上我们从小就认识。

sentences.english: Actually, on second thoughts, I don’t think I want to go out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 其实再想想，我今晚不打算出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add new information to what you have just said, to give your opinion, or to start a new conversation

sentences.english: The house was lovely and warm.
sentences.chinese: 那房子漂亮温暖。

sentences.english: I hope we get some warm weather soon.
sentences.chinese: 我希望天气很快就会回暖。

sentences.english: I’ve put your dinner in the oven to keep it warm.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的饭菜放进了烤箱里保温。

sentences.english: warm water
sentences.chinese: 温水

detailed_translations.english: slightly hot, especially in a pleasant way
to make someone or something warm or warmer, or to become warm or warmer

name: warm
trans: 加热, 使温暖, 变暖和

sentences.english: The house was lovely and warm.
sentences.chinese: 那房子漂亮温暖。

sentences.english: I hope we get some warm weather soon.
sentences.chinese: 我希望天气很快就会回暖。

sentences.english: I’ve put your dinner in the oven to keep it warm.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的饭菜放进了烤箱里保温。

sentences.english: warm water
sentences.chinese: 温水

detailed_translations.english: slightly hot, especially in a pleasant way
to make someone or something warm or warmer, or to become warm or warmer

sentences.english: There’s plenty of fun for all the family.
sentences.chinese: 可以让全家人玩得很开心。

sentences.english: The children were having so much fun, I hated to call them inside.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子玩得很开心，我不忍心把他们叫进来。

detailed_translations.english: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting

name: really
trans: 真实地, 真正地, 实际上

sentences.english: Why don’t you tell us what really happened?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不把真相告诉我们？

sentences.english: Oliver’s not really her brother.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗其实不是她弟弟。

sentences.english: I never know what he’s really thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我从来都不知道他的真实想法。

sentences.english: She seems unfriendly at first, but she’s really very nice.
sentences.chinese: 一开始她似乎并不友善，但其实她人很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 真正地， 实际上； 很， 十分， 全然
detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think

sentences.english: a pretty little girl
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的小姑娘

sentences.english: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

detailed_translations.english: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

sentences.english: It feels very cold today.
sentences.chinese: 今天很冷。

sentences.english: The fishing industry is very important to the area.
sentences.chinese: 捕鱼业对于该地区非常重要。

sentences.english: The traffic’s moving very slowly this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上车流非常缓慢。

sentences.english: problems that are very similar to mine
sentences.chinese: 和我非常相似的问题

sentences.english: I feel a lot better – thank you very much.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好多了，非常感谢。

sentences.english: I’m very, very (= used for emphasis ) pleased you can come.
sentences.chinese: 你能来我真是非常高兴。

sentences.english: It’s very kind of you to help.
sentences.chinese: 您来帮忙真是太好了。

sentences.english: My sister and I were married on the very same (= exactly the same ) day.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐在同一天结婚。

sentences.english: He died in this very room.
sentences.chinese: 他就是在这个房间里去世的。

sentences.english: I’ll start at the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我要从头开始。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize an adjective, adverb, or phrase
used to emphasize that you are talking exactly about one particular thing or person

name: so
trans: 这么, 那么, 就那样, 像这样, 多么, 非常, 如此

sentences.english: The troops will not advance until ordered to do so .
sentences.chinese: 在接到命令之前，部队不会前进。

sentences.english: Did Luke sell them? And, if so , what happened to the money?
sentences.chinese: 卢克把它们卖了吗？如果是这样的话，那钱到哪里去了？

sentences.english: ‘Has he lost a fortune?’ ‘ So they say .’
sentences.chinese: “他输掉了一大笔钱吗？”“他们是这么说的。”

sentences.english: ‘Look – I’ve even cleaned the windows.’ ‘ So I see .’
sentences.chinese: “瞧，我把窗子也擦干净了。”“我看到了。”

sentences.english: Parents can withdraw their child from school if they so wish .
sentences.chinese: 家长要是愿意，可以让孩子退学。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer back to an idea, action, quality, situation etc that has just been mentioned
used to say that someone does something because of the reason just stated

name: rather
trans: 相当, 有点儿, 颇

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

name: quite
trans: 相当, 完全, 十分, 很

sentences.english: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，那是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我对此感到相当痛苦。

sentences.english: Well, actually it requires quite a bit of work and research.
sentences.chinese: 呃，实际上这需要相当多的工作和研究。

sentences.english: I can see it quite clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我能清清楚楚地看见它。

detailed_translations.english: completely

sentences.english: Your father took out insurance to cover the mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲购买了抵押借款保险。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them money, especially regularly, and they pay the costs if something bad happens, for example if you become ill or your car is damaged
